title.narrative: Rapid response to and mitigation of public health risks in drought-affected districts of Galmudug, and South West State

description.narrative: The aim of this $2m WHO project is to strengthen the provision of integrated essential primary health care services. CERF funding will enable the provision of 166,533 healthcare consultations, the treatment of 5,830 children suffering from severe acute malnutrition as well as vaccination of 5,830 children against measles. WHO will also procure essential medicines and equipment to treat severe acute malnutrition, trauma and cholera. In addition, WHO will deploy rapid response teams and support health facilities to ensure quick detection, investigation and response to disease outbreaks. Community health workers will be deployed to raise awareness on best practices for disease prevention and control. In total, WHO seeks to reach 166,533 drought-affected Somalis, including 49,127 women and 31,641 girls.
